intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: The road ahead seems heavily forested. Is that where we're going?

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Yes. It is dense, but there's a path that leads to the Bottomless Canyon. This whole area is the domain of Mokushu, another independent nation. If we encounter any of its citizens, they should be friendly, but... We would be wise to remember how Nohr compromised Izumo before we arrived.

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: I wouldn't worry about Nohr strong-arming Mokushu, milady. The locals are well known for their proficiency in the martial arts. Many great ninja have sharpened their craft here. No, it's likely that Nohr's strategists would have tried to avoid this area. Even if it meant taking the long route.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: And we haven't heard about any battles in the area—another good sign.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Very well. Let's proceed.

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: Boo! Betcha didn't expect to see me here!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Zola! You've been following us! You're massively outnumbered, so you can't possibly be in search of a fight.

intro.speaker: Hinoka
intro.line: Relax, Corrin. He probably just came back to offer me a chance to cut him. Wasn't that thoughtful of him.

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: No! Please! I'm defeated. I did not show up here to challenge all of you by myself. I came here to surrender...and to seek amnesty.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: And why should we trust you?

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: Well, to be honest...you shouldn't. I tried to kill you. But you saw what Lord Leo was about to do to me. I can no longer return to Nohr. I am exiled. Without the backing of an army, I am of little danger to you. But maybe I could be of some assistance...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Hmm...

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Corrin! Surely you can't be considering his proposal?

intro.speaker: Hinoka
intro.line: Can I cut him yet?

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: Eeeek! Stay away from me, please!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I think we should bring him with us.

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: Wait, really?

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Yes, really, Corrin?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Yes. As he said, he's of little danger to us by himself. And he may prove to have some value. Lastly, it is not the Hoshidan way to turn one's back on the helpless.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: You have a kind heart, Corrin. Perhaps too kind.

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: Oh, thank you, Prince/Princess Corrin! I can't believe I let King Garon convince me that you deserved to die. What you've done here today shows your true character—that of a brave leader!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: You're overreacting, Zola. And please remember... If any of us catch you doing ANYTHING suspicious... I WILL allow Hinoka to cut you down.

intro.speaker: Hinoka
intro.line: I'll always be standing by, knife at the ready, Corrin. So don't even think about doing anything stupid. You got that?

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: Yes, milady!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Ahh. This forest air is refreshing. And I have to say. I'm enjoying this path a fair bit more than the Eternal Stairway... Are we getting anywhere close to the Bottomless Canyon, Sakura?

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: Yes, I believe so. *sigh*

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: What's the matter? Are you getting tired?

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: No... I was just th-thinking about Ryoma and Takumi... Sometimes I forget that they're missing, and then when I remember... It's like a wound is freshly opened.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I know the feeling. But please try to stay positive. Worrying about it isn't going to do anything but drive you crazy.

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: You're right. I'll do my best!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: That's the spirit. Whoa... Watch out!

intro.speaker: Sakura
intro.line: Ahhh!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: A shuriken?! Get down, everyone!

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: This belongs to a Mokushu ninja.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: I sense the presence of many... I believe we're surrounded, Corrin.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Blast! So much for Nohr staying away from Mokushu.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: I'm not sure we're dealing with Nohr...

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: I think she's right. I know that Nohr wants no fight with the kingdom of Mokushu.

intro.speaker: Hinoka
intro.line: How convenient. Come here, runt.

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: Awwk! Please remove that blade from my throat!

intro.speaker: Hinoka
intro.line: Not until you tell us what's going on.

intro.speaker: Zola
intro.line: Gah! Your guess is as good as mine! Perhaps Nohr has made an alliance with Mokushu.

intro.speaker: Kotaro
intro.line: The deformed one is correct. Our kingdom has made an arrangement with Nohr.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Who are you?

intro.speaker: Kotaro
intro.line: I am Kotaro, daimyo of Mokushu.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: And what is your quarrel with us, Daimyo Kotaro? We merely seek passage through your territory.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Yes. Our understanding was that Mokushu is an independent nation. Yet you are now beholden to Nohr?

intro.speaker: Kotaro
intro.line: Beholden? Pah! Mokushu is beholden to no nation. Our interests simply happen to line up with those of Nohr for the time being. Once Hoshido is defeated, King Garon will grant us considerable new territory. We've long been waiting for the chance to expand. And this war is the perfect opportunity.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: So you're a war profiteer. How noble.

intro.speaker: Kaze
intro.line: Gods. The famous daimyo of Mokushu turns out to be a scheming politician. I don't even have words for how disappointing that is.

intro.speaker: Kotaro
intro.line: And even if you did, it wouldn't make a difference. Grow up, foolish Hoshidans. Only the ambitious prosper in this world.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: It was careless of us not to think of this possibility.

intro.speaker: Kotaro
intro.line: Indeed! Now that I have you all in one place, I can end the war today. I look forward to building a castle on the smoking ruins where Hoshido once stood.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Go on, keep talking. I'll savor making you eat those words.

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: Great, what now? Wait...is that who I think it is?

battle.speaker: Hinoka
battle.line: I'm so happy to see you again, Brother!

battle.speaker: Hinoka
battle.line: Gah! What's wrong with you? That arrow almost hit me!

battle.speaker: Takumi
battle.line: I should have been the chosen one...

battle.speaker: Takumi
battle.line: I am ignored...alone...forgotten. But I am more powerful than they can imagine!

battle.speaker: Corrin
battle.line: What are you saying? Snap out of it, Takumi!

battle.speaker: Takumi
battle.line: Ughhhh... I will not stand in the shadows any longer... They will all see me for the first time! I will make them pay for what they've done. I will make them...I will make them... DIE!

battle.speaker: Azura
battle.line: Look at the color of his eyes... Could it be? There's only one way to find out. I'll have to sing to him...

recruit-talk.speaker: Takumi
recruit-talk.line: No one...notices me. No one...cares. Die. Die. Die. Die. Die. Die.

recruit-talk.speaker: Azura
recruit-talk.line: It doesn't matter. I'm someone who can help. You're being controlled by a dark force. This is not who you are! You don't have to give in. You can survive this! Listen carefully...

recruit-talk.speaker: Azura
recruit-talk.line: Takumi, can you hear me now?

recruit-talk.speaker: Azura
recruit-talk.line: Yes, it's me! Oh, thank goodness.

recruit-talk.speaker: Azura
recruit-talk.line: Unfortunately, we're right in the middle of a battle. I don't really have time to explain. Are you in any condition to defend yourself?

recruit-talk.speaker: Takumi
recruit-talk.line: I...I think so. I feel OK.

recruit-talk.speaker: Azura
recruit-talk.line: Very well. Just remember.. You're strong and intelligent. There's a certain something about you. I believe in you, Takumi.

recruit-talk.speaker: Azura
recruit-talk.line: That's the Takumi I remember. Now, come on! You'll need to focus to make it through this battle.

recruit-talk.speaker: Takumi
recruit-talk.line: Wait! Azura! Ugh, I'm still a bit woozy. So many questions... I guess I'll just have to stay alive to get them answered.

recruit-battle.speaker: Takumi
recruit-battle.line: Die. Die. Die. Die. Die. Die. Die...

recruit-battle.speaker: Kotaro
recruit-battle.line: Thank you SO much for walking right into my domain. Perhaps I'll name one of the latrines in my new castle in your honor.

recruit-battle.speaker: Saizo
recruit-battle.line: Kotaro of Mokushu...you will now answer to me.

recruit-battle.speaker: Kotaro
recruit-battle.line: I answer to no one. Who are you to suggest otherwise?

recruit-battle.speaker: Saizo
recruit-battle.line: I am Saizo the Fifth, servant to the Hoshidan royal family.

recruit-battle.speaker: Kotaro
recruit-battle.line: Saizo...that's familiar. I believe I've murdered others of your pitiful lineage.

recruit-battle.speaker: Saizo
recruit-battle.line: You—! How dare you! My father was an honorable man.

recruit-battle.speaker: Kotaro
recruit-battle.line: Honorable? Maybe. Weak? Definitely. That balding old fool had the audacity to lecture ME! So naturally...I put an end to his life.

recruit-battle.speaker: Saizo
recruit-battle.line: I knew you were the one responsible for his death. Coward!

recruit-battle.speaker: Kotaro
recruit-battle.line: Bwahaha! Isn't this a stroke of luck? To fell both father and son with the same blade... How poetic!

recruit-battle.speaker: Saizo
recruit-battle.line: I'm about to rewrite your poem...

recruit-battle.speaker: Kotaro
recruit-battle.line: Please. If you're anything like your father, you won't land a single blow!

recruit-battle.speaker: Saizo
recruit-battle.line: How's that? Did I land a single blow?

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Unhh... I am invisible...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Takumi! TAKUMI! He's still not responsive. I don't want to attack him, but... What should we do?

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Ughhh...

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: I have an idea, Corrin. But I'll need to get close to him.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: All right. Just be careful. Who knows what he's capable of in this state.

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: What... are you...

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: It doesn't matter. I'm someone who can help. Listen carefully!

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Ugh... Gyaaaaah!

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Takumi! Can you hear me?

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Ugh... Oh, man... What's going on? Why is everyone looking at me?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Takumi! You're back!

end.speaker: Sakura
end.line: Brother! I'm so glad you're back to normal. We were all so w-worried about you.

end.speaker: Hinoka
end.line: Yeah. Don't ever do that again, OK?

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Whoa, guys! Stop crying. You're making me all embarrassed.

end.speaker: Sakura
end.line: I don't care. We didn't know if we'd ever see you again. And then when you showed up all weird like that...

end.speaker: Hinoka
end.line: Yeah. We didn't know if you'd ever be the same Takumi we know and love again.

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Well, it's definitely me guys. Thank you for your concern. And I'm sorry I made you all worried.

end.speaker: Hinata
end.line: Phew! I'm glad Lord Takumi is safe and sound after all. It wasn't looking good for us for a while there...

end.speaker: Oboro
end.line: Lord Takumi! Now that you're back, we'll never let anything happen to you again!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: It's good to have you back, Takumi. But as much as I would like to savor this moment. Ryoma is still missing. Can you tell us anything about what happened to you two?

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Yeah. It was insane. We ran into Nohrian troops just outside Izumo and began fighting. Ryoma and I were separated in the early stages of combat, before we had to retreat. We were outnumbered...and pushed to the brink of the Bottomless Canyon.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: So we still have no idea where he is...

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: No, I'm afraid not. Something triggered a massive landslide, and I was caught up in it. That's how I fell into the canyon.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: You actually fell into the Bottomless Canyon? How are you still alive?

end.speaker: Hinoka
end.line: I've never heard of anyone returning from there before.

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: I...I have no idea. All I remember is falling. There was a period of darkness, and then I woke up here.

end.speaker: Hinoka
end.line: Well, I'm just glad to have you back. It's a miracle you survived a fall like that!

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: So, um, can anyone tell me how I ended up here? Or what, exactly, I was doing before I woke up just no?

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: It's best you don't worry about it for now. Just get some rest.

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: No, I need to know. My Fujin Yumi was in my hand when I came to. And some of you have wounds in your backs...

end.speaker: Hinoka
end.line: Well...

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Tell me! What did I do?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Takumi...you must have been under some sort of spell. You stumbled out of the woods and started attacking our party. Please, try not to worry about it. We know it wasn't really you.

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Oh, what have I done? A prince attacking his own men? How can I show my face in Hoshido again?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Please! Someone...or something...was controlling you. We know you were not in your right mind.

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: That's small comfort right now, I'm afraid.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Well, I'm sorry you feel that way, but all that matters now is that we're all here. Will you join us in the search for Ryoma? Perhaps something along the way will jog your memory. Can we count on you?

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Yes. If you can forgive me for all the hurtful things I've said and done.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Of course. We must move forward—not dwell on the past.

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: Thank you, Corrin. I also need to thank you...Sister.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Oh! You called me— I mean...you're quite welcome, Takumi. Ahem... *cough* *cough*

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Is everything OK, Azura? You don't look well.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: I'm fine. I think I'm just a bit tired. Please, don't worry about me. I'll be better in no time.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: If you say so.

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: Excuse me, everyone. I have more good news. Our forces rescued Kagero from an underground prison nearby. Welcome back, Kagero.

end.speaker: Kagero
end.line: Hello, everyone. Good day, milady.

end.speaker: Hinoka
end.line: Welcome back! Are you all right? Do you know what happened to Ryoma?

end.speaker: Kagero
end.line: Yes. But I'm afraid—

end.speaker: Hinoka
end.line: No! Ryoma could not have fallen to the Nohr army. It isn't possible!

end.speaker: Sakura
end.line: No! Brother... *sob* *sob*

end.speaker: Takumi
end.line: I can't believe he's gone...

end.speaker: Hinoka
end.line: We will build a monument to his glory when we return home...

end.speaker: Kagero
end.line: Please, if you would allow me to continue. Lord Ryoma is still alive, as far as I know.

end.speaker: Hinoka
end.line: But? You said you were afraid of something.

end.speaker: Kagero
end.line: I was going to say I'm afraid I don't know exactly where he is. After being separated from Lord Takumi, Lord Ryoma met with a Hoshidan scout. The scout informed him of a new civil strife in Nohr. Ryoma departed at once in the direction of Cheve.

end.speaker: Hinoka
end.line: Cheve...so he's on his way to Nohr right now!

end.speaker: Kagero
end.line: I can only assume so. I was given the order to return to Hoshido and report this information... But I was careless while traveling through Mokushu and ended up being caught. I must apologize to everyone for such shameful conduct.

end.speaker: Hinoka
end.line: It's OK. We're just glad to see you alive. And knowing that Ryoma is still out there is valuable information to have.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Yes. But we should depart quickly if we hope to catch up to him. Corrin, this may mean returning all the way to Nohr. Are you ready to do that?

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Yes, of course.

end.speaker: Kaze
end.line: If we travel by sea, it will be faster. We should head to the nearest port town. And even though Kotaro is defeated we should take care. There will surely be other ninja who share his ambition, lying in wait...

end.speaker: Kagero
end.line: Yes, that sounds wise. I've also dispatched another ally back to Hoshido. He will warn everyone to avoid this area for the time being. I expect he'll reach Hoshido and inform Yukimura within half a day or so. Lord/Lady Corrin, would you permit me to join you? I feel I must make up for my previous shortcomings.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: You owe nothing, but we would be more than happy to have you. Everyone—the sooner we find Ryoma, the sooner we can end this war.
